task_summary: Pick the disk from the shelf using the robot arm, based on visual input and sequential manipulation.

task_long_description.overview: A blue robotic arm attempts to pick up a disk-shaped object from a cubby shelf in a modern kitchen setting. The sequence involves perception, approach, alignment, grasp, and post-grasp verification. The robot operates from a left-approach angle, with no apparent obstructions. The gripper opens before approaching the target disk. Scene context cues suggest this is a simple tabletop pick with moderate constraints on time and precision.
preconditions: Disk is present on accessible shelf.
No obstructions between gripper and disk.
stepwise_plan: Check if the disk is visible.
If not visible, scan using raster pattern up to three times.
Open the gripper to a legal width.
Move the gripper above the disk with sufficient clearance.
Approach and align to the disk.
Grasp the disk from above with top strategy and moderate force.
success_criteria: Disk is inside the gripper after grasp.
failure_and_recovery: If disk not found: scan and retry up to 3 times.
If grasp is unstable: abort and optionally retry.
If approach fails: re-align or restart phase.
task_long_description.termination: Sequence completes after verifying stable grasp of the disk.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the disk is visible to the perception system.
Performs a raster scan to search for the disk.
Detects precise location of the disk.
Opens the gripper to prepare to grasp the disk.
Moves gripper above the disk with fixed vertical offset.
Approaches and aligns gripper to the disk within tight tolerance.
Executes top-down grasp of the disk with minimum force.
Verifies successful and stable grasp of the disk.

recovery_strategy: Retry scan sequence for missing object.
Abort or alert on repeated grasp/approach failure.
assumptions: The object being picked is a disk located in a cubby shelf as per frames.
No container (e.g., door or bin) to open; direct access assumed.
Instruction is minimal, but frames clarify object pose and grasp approach.
Top grasp is chosen based on gripper alignment in images.

expected_success_criteria: Disk securely held by gripper following sequence without collision.
